question.questionA: Papillose  annuals; perianth  segments  five, greenish white, sepaloid; stamens ten.
question.questionB: Annuals or perennials; petals and stamens numerous.

question.questionA: Leaves green, gradually tapering to a point; flowers to 10 cm across;petals pale lilac, yellow or orange; stamens yellow.
question.questionB: Leaves glaucous, broadest towards the tip, abruptly narrowed to an acute  apex;  flowers  to 12  cm  across; petals  brilliant red-carmine; stamens purple.

question.questionA: Stigmas surrounded by a raised ring.
question.questionB: Stigmas not surrounded by a raised ring.

question.questionA: Plants covered with transparent glossy swellings (resembling hoar frost); leaves green oval, flattened, fleshy; flowers 2-3 cm across.
question.questionB: Plants not covered with glossy swellings; leaves green,  often turning red towards the tip, oblong-cylindrical, fleshy; flowers c. 1 cm across.
